content:
Thank you. How did you create the copy of the profile to move to new computer? Please be as specific as possible. For example, did you do it while Thunderbird was running? If so, that may have caused the profile copy to be corrupted and omit folders from the copy. If this is a windows computer, would you be able to restart the old computer and copy the profile again? Here are the basic steps for a successful transfer from one windows pc to another:

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

If doing that is not possible, can you create a screenshot of the profile folder that you copied to place on new computer? That would be very useful. If you are unsure how to do a screenshot to upload, let me know.
creator: davidsk

content:
First, disable the Account Hub in Settings/General, then add the account from ⩸ - New Account - Email. Enter your credentials and proceed with Manual config. ACC accounts use gmail settings:

Incoming imap.gmail.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, your ACC email address

outgoing smtp.gmail.com, 465, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, your ACC email address

https://students.austincc.edu/help/accmail/accmail-activation-login-assistance/

https://students.austincc.edu/help/accmail/accmail-questions-answers/
creator: sfhowes

creator: davidsk

content:
david said
Is thunderbird invoking a third-party app? If so, might the setting be in that app? I offer this only as a comment, not as a solution.

The only PDF reader I have installed is Okular and when I open PDFs in that, it defaults to Page Width correctly. So I doubt that is the issue. I would prefer to open PDF's directly in Thunderbird and not use an external app.
creator: moz42

content:
In TB 128, open Config. editor and type pdf in the search. There is a preference, pdfjs.defaultZoomValue, with no value assigned. If you change it to something like 150, pdf files will open with the automatic zoom at 150%.

This pref. isn't present in 141, and adding it as a new pref. has no effect.
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
In TB 128, open Config. editor and type pdf in the search. There is a preference, pdfjs.defaultZoomValue, with no value assigned. If you change it to something like 150, pdf files will open with the automatic zoom at 150%. This pref. isn't present in 141, and adding it as a new pref. has no effect.

Thank you so much. I had to work out the correct zoom level first. For anyone else wanting to do this, I selected "page width" then used the plus to increase percentage and minus to bring it down. I got the value I needed to change pdfjs.defaultZoomValue with.

(For beginners like me, Config Editor is located in settings and its right at the bottom. "Config Editor...")
creator: moz42

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

creator: bengroteone

content:
The code I posted only colours the Today Pane background, not the events themselves (see picture). This is for TB 128 or 141 and the system theme on W11. To apply the same colour to the Tasks part of the pane, add this css: 

.calendar-task-treechildren{background-color: pink !important;}
creator: sfhowes

content: I suggest this: - create at least one address, if not already done, in addressbook - export the csv - open in a spreadsheet program and also open your Outlook-created csv. Compare the top line and adjust the Outlook one to mirror the thunderbird one - this should now import easily.
